title: Chained consumer price index of all urban consumers 2000 to 2019
summary: This bar chart has 20 columns on the x axis representing December value, and Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) in each December value on the y axis.
The Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) is appeared to be the highest at December value 2019 and lowest at December value 2000.
The difference of Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) between the highest and lowest December value is 42.13.

max_summary: This bar chart has 20 columns on the x axis representing December value, and Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) in each December value on the y axis.
The Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) is highest at December value 2019 and lowest at December value 2000.
The difference of Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) between the highest and lowest December value is 42.13.
The December value 2019 has the highest Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100), followed by 2018, and 2017. Down to the December value 2000 which is the lowest.
The December value 2000 tends to be 1.17 percent lower than average.
Summing up the values of all December values, we get total 2483.76.
